se.westpay.libserial

Interface Com

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SerialCommunication

    public interface Com
    The Com interface provide methods that enables the use of the serial communication port.
    Implementation of the Com interface is provided in the class SerialCommunication.
    To start using the serial communication an instance of the class SerialCommunication needs to be created.
    Below examples show how to connect to the serial communication port,
    setup callback to get notification when data is available for reading and method to write data.

    Create instance of the SerialCommunication class and do connect. 
             ...
         
           SerialCommunication = _serialCommunication = new SerialCommunication();
           if (_serialCommunication.connect(_baudRate)) {
             setDataAvailableCallback();
             Toast.makeText(SerialComActivity.this, "Successful connect!", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
           } else {
             Toast.makeText(SerialComActivity.this, "Unsuccessful connect!", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
           }
         
         ...
    Setup data available callback and read data when it is available. 
             
           private void setDataAvailableCallback() {
             _serialCommunication.setDataAvailableCallback(new DataAvailable()  {
               Override
               public void onDataAvailable(SerialCommunication.EventTypes event) {
                 if (event == SerialCommunication.EventTypes.DATA_AVAILABLE) {
                   byte [] buffer = new byte[MAX_BUFFER_SIZE];
                   _serialCommunication.read(buffer, buffer.length);
                 }
               }
             });
           }
    Write to the serial port. 
             ...
         
           byte[] buffer = text.getBytes();
           _serialCommunication.write(buffer, buffer.length);
         
         ...

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        boolean connect(Com.BaudRates baudRate)
        Open and connect to the serial port.
        Parameters:
        baudRate - Baud rate to use.
        Returns:
        boolean - true success, false otherwise.

      • connect

        boolean connect(Com.BaudRates baudRate,
                Com.StopBits stopBits,
                Com.DataBits dataBits,
                Com.Parity parity)
        Open and connect to the serial port.
        Parameters:
        baudRate - Baud rate to use.
        stopBits - Number of stop bits.
        dataBits - Number of data bits per byte.
        parity - Enable parity generation and detection.
        Returns:
        boolean - true success, false otherwise.

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
        Disconnect the connected port.

      • read

        int read(byte[] data,
         int length)
        Read data from the serial communication port. Timeout default 3 seconds.
        Parameters:
        data - Read buffer.
        length - Length to read.
        Returns:
        int - Number of bytes read.

      • read

        int read(byte[] data,
         int length,
         int timeout)
        Read data from the serial communication port.
        Parameters:
        data - Read buffer.
        length - Length to read.
        timeout - Timeout for the read operation.
        Returns:
        int - Number of bytes read.

      • write

        int write(byte[] data,
          int length)
        Write data to the serial communication port. Timeout default 3 seconds.
        Parameters:
        data - Write buffer.
        length - Length to read.
        Returns:
        int - Number of bytes written.

      • write

        int write(byte[] data,
          int length,
          int timeout)
        Write data to the serial communication port.
        Parameters:
        data - Write buffer.
        length - Length to read.
        timeout - Timeout for the write operation. Default 3 seconds.
        Returns:
        int - Number of bytes written.

      • isOpened

        boolean isOpened()
        Check if serial communication port is open.
        Returns:
        boolean - true if the serial port is open, false otherwise.

      • setDataAvailableCallback

        void setDataAvailableCallback(DataAvailable dataAvailable)
        Set data available callback for the application layer.
        Parameters:
        dataAvailable - Callback object that is called when data is available.
